statement.p: Tiana is conducting market research on the cost of homeowners insurance. Tiana has determined that the average annual cost of homeowners insurance is 1143, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 95.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends less than 1244 on homeowners insurance.
b. The cost of the middle 30 of homeowners insurance policies falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 18 of homeowners insurance policies cost at least how much annually?

b. For the middle 30 of the data, need the remaining 70 of the data split between the left and right tails of the distribution.
